001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004
005/**
006 * A simple linear scalar model of the form:
007 * <pre>
008 *   f(x) = bias + Σ w_i * x_i
009 * </pre>
010 * where the bias and weights are trainable parameters.
011 * <p>
012 * This class supports forward estimation of the scalar output as well as
013 * calculation of parameter gradients required for gradient-based training.
014 */
015@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
016public class LinearCombination extends LinearModel implements TrainableScalarFunction {
017
018    /**
019     * Creates a new {@code LinearCombination} with the specified number of input dimensions.
020     * <p>
021     * The underlying parameter vector will have length {@code dimensions + 1},
022     * with the first element reserved for the bias and the rest for the weights.
023     *
024     * @param dimensions number of input features
025     * @return a new {@code LinearCombination} instance with zero-initialized parameters
026     */
027    public static LinearCombination create(int dimensions) {
028        return new LinearCombination(new float[dimensions + 1]);
029    }
030
031    /**
032     * Constructs a {@code LinearCombination} with the given parameter vector.
033     * <p>
034     * The first element of the array is treated as the bias, while the subsequent
035     * elements are the weights.
036     *
037     * @param parameters parameter vector (bias + weights)
038     */
039    public LinearCombination(float[] parameters) {
040        super(parameters);
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Estimates the scalar output of this linear model for the given input vector.
045     * <p>
046     * The computation is:
047     * <pre>
048     *   output = bias + Σ (inputs[i] * weights[i])
049     * </pre>
050     *
051     * @param inputs the input feature vector
052     * @return the scalar output value
053     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code inputs.length != arity()}
054     */
055    @Override
056    public float estimateScalar(float[] inputs) {
057        if (inputs.length != arity()) {
058            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
059        }
060        float sum = getBias();
061        for (int d = 1; d <= arity(); d++) {
062            sum += inputs[d - 1] * getWeight(d);
063        }
064        return sum;
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Calculates the gradients of the output with respect to all parameters (bias and weights)
069     * for the given input vector.
070     * <p>
071     * The gradient vector has length {@code 1 + arity()}, where:
072     * <ul>
073     *   <li>Index 0 corresponds to the derivative w.r.t. the bias (always {@code 1}).</li>
074     *   <li>Indices 1..arity correspond to the input values, i.e. ∂f/∂w_i = input[i-1].</li>
075     * </ul>
076     *
077     * @param inputs the input feature vector
078     * @return the gradient vector (bias gradient followed by weight gradients)
079     */
080    public float[] calculateParameterGradients(float[] inputs) {
081        float[] gradients = new float[1 + arity()];
082        gradients[0] = 1;
083        if (arity() >= 0) System.arraycopy(inputs, 0, gradients, 1, arity());
084        return gradients;
085    }
086}
